oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wood's Ferry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African Americans; Ferries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ferry operator John Downs, his son Ernest Downs, and horse Jinnie with ferry on Cumberland River.
In 1882, John Downs took over the operation of the ferry, which ran between Wilson and Sumner Counties, across the Cumberland River, from 1801-1954.
